trans-unit.source: Provides customized assembly binding for designers that are used to create [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/add/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] apps.
This feature is used only in developer mode for [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/add/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] apps.
It enables designers to supply isolated binding contexts as required, during iterative development of assemblies.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.DesignerServices.WindowsRuntimeDesignerContext"></xref> class, specifying the set of paths to search for third-party [!INCLUDE[wrt](~/add/includes/wrt-md.md)] types and for managed assemblies, and specifying the name of the context.
The paths to search.
The name of the context.
The current application domain is not the default application domain.
-or- The process is not running in the app container.
-or- The computer does not have a developer license.
name or paths is .
Loads the specified assembly from the current context.
The full name of the assembly to load.
For a description of full assembly names, see the <xref:System.Reflection.Assembly.FullName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The assembly, if it is found in the current context; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Loads the specified type from the current context.
The assembly-qualified name of the type to load.
For a description of assembly-qualified names, see the <xref:System.Type.AssemblyQualifiedName%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The type, if it is found in the current context; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Creates a context and sets it as the shared context.
The shared context cannot be set more than once.
<xref:System.Runtime.DesignerServices.WindowsRuntimeDesignerContext> is supported only in the default application domain.
An enumerable collection of paths that are used to resolve binding requests that cannot be satisfied by the iteration context.
The shared context has already been set in this application domain.
-or- The current application domain is not the default application domain.
-or- The process is not running in the app container.
-or- The computer does not have a developer license.
paths is .
Gets the name of the designer binding context.
The name of the context.
Sets a context to handle iterations of assembly binding requests, as assemblies are recompiled during the design process.
The context can be replaced with a new binding context at any time, as required by the needs of the designer.
<xref:System.Runtime.DesignerServices.WindowsRuntimeDesignerContext> is supported only in the default application domain.
The context that handles iterations of assembly binding requests.
The current application domain is not the default application domain.
context is .
